comment.author: 22968943@N05
comment._content: At the same time though, the lettering on the bow, admittedly very obscured doesn't look like the tops of the word "Moreno" to my admittedly bad eyes.  Looks perhaps like a "YA" in the middle?

comment.author: 8964329@N05
comment._content: It clearly says Rivadavia. First president of Argentina, and future name of the battleship.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Another Bain/LOC photo of the Rivadavia at Quincy. Photo dated Dec. 2, 1912:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2448661525/]

Bain/LOC photo from 1911 shows Rivadavia after launch, but before completion:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4546005394/]

Two Bain/LOC photos of the Rivadavia in dry dock [at Charlestown, Mass.], in 1913:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/3931067681/]
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/3931067333/]
